title: Diversity and Inclusion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Assumptions were made about me following the psychometric testing. Being hugely self aware means I know my issues; what the testing doesn't reveal is how I manage and mitigate my short comings. This could be revealed if asked.
Interview Questions: This was at pre interview assessment.

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CIPD (Wimbledon, England) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was insightful, engaging and stress free. A loving team and wonderful work environment. It has a great work life balance. They lead by example when it comes to HR.
Interview Questions: Role play Situational interview questions Group activity

title: HR-Admin Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CIPD in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
3 stage interview

Phone
Test (Psychology + maths!?)
1:1
I had a phone interview with test, after that I never heard from them again. I even sent a follow-up - no response. The human decency require to at least finish what you started. If you started the interview process, it would be great to send a response. If someone is sending a follow-up, is so hard to give a one sentence with some feedback? 

Also, what is the point of giving such a high level maths test, or any maths test for the HR position?

Extremely dehumanizing process and company - avoid at all cost!
Interview Questions: The train is going with x speed, what time it will get to the station

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews only to never hear back from anyone. Was passed from pillar post about who would like to interview me next. Was given all the chat about what a great fit I’d be. Process dragged on for months. Completely unprofessional and a very backwards organisation.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience to date?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Psychometric tests, couple of interviews with various people around the business and a task to complete as part of the final interview. I was asked a range of question about my experience and what I would do in certain scenarios.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when I've needed to provide challenging feedback.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: 2 stage interview. Promised feedback after both stages but never received anything. Also promised a phone call regarding other potential role but never called. Incredibly slow and un-coordinated. Old-fashioned interview style with questions that are not relevant in present work world. Also, they were suprised when I was not able to tell bad things about my current workplace. Very odd experience, would not apply again.
Interview Questions: how do you like to be managed?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CIPD
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, 2 stages. Phone interview, then in person. Standard questions. Make sure to revise the job spec and know why you want to work at CIPD. I wouldn't worry about it as long as you have revised and you have experience

title: Communications Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: All interviews conducted virtually. Involved an initial conversation with their recruitment team, followed by a two stage process with the hiring team. Competency based interview with a task related to the role included.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a comms crisis?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CIPD in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Competency based and work based test. Questions to test previous experience and relevant skills, based on person specification. . Work-based test to mark and assess a student's work and give feedback.
Interview Questions: How would you give feedback to a student who had failed an assignment?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process felt consistent and fair with a chance to meet wider members of the team. The assessment process was also clear and allowed a chance to demonstrate the skills required to complete the role in it's entirety.

title: Marketing Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CIPD
Interview Descriptions: The application was via LinkedIn where I submitted my cv and cover letter. This was then followed by a phone interview and then being invited for a face to to face interview which also included a test on copy writing for email and ad.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for CIPD

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CIPD (Wimbledon, England) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The process was conducted through a mixture of different mediums, depending on the stage. I kicked off with a half hour phone interview with a friendly marketing consultant who (I think) just wanted to ascertain I had the knowledge / experience indicated on my CV. He also took some time out to tell me more about the CIPD; the project I'd be working on if successful, the progress they'd made and where the role I applied for would fit into the overall strategy. 

I then had a couple of face-to face interviews with people from two different teams as the role worked with both. The interviews were relaxed and friendly, so I felt at ease and able to give the best answers I could. I also wrote a report which responded to a hypothetical scenario, saying what I would do and why. Overall it was a good mixture, and although there were a lot of stafes (four altogether), it meant that when I was offered the role, I felt really comfortable that I'd be a good fit.
Interview Questions: I really can't remember specific questions! I think they asked me what the three key skills were that made me good for the role, and then asked me to talk around those skills.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CIPD (London, England) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR rep to go through some standard questions and and then with Director for 1:1 interview covering more specific knowledge.  Was personable and reasonable but felt that I was being judged on what i was doing NOW (few staff managed) rather than my track record (of managing large teams over a long period of time.
Interview Questions: Given your age, what do you know about social media?
